definition: to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: We are to try for peace. This does not mean pacifism .
sentences.chinese: 我们要努力谋求和平，但不代表和平主义。

sentences.english: They were all virulently pacifistic and anti-nationalistic.
sentences.chinese: 他们坚持极度的和平主义和反国家主义。

sentences.english: Christian Pacifism is the most concentrated expression of Kagawa's thought.
sentences.chinese: 基督教和平主义思想是贺川思想的最为集中的体现。

sentences.english: Many japanese cannot tolerate that pacificism .
sentences.chinese: 很多日本人没办法忍受和平主义。

sentences.english: He later cast aside his pacifism.
sentences.chinese: 后来，他放弃了和平主义立场。

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism
bushidō or way of the warrior, samurai code of chivalry
